definition: to bring up/to train/to contribute to/achievements (usually of young people)
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: Billy: Coach Malone, tell Robert good shoes make good players.
sentences.chinese: 可奇马龙，告诉罗勃特好鞋造就好的运动员。

sentences.english: Thus, it is not surprising that Hong Kong finally lays claim to Prof Cui's achievement.
sentences.chinese: 因此，香港最终能够造就出一个崔教授，并不稀奇。

sentences.english: Hollywood can make the most famous film stars in the world.
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞可以造就世界上最著名的影星。

sentences.english: Heaven and earth never agreed better to frame a place for man's habitation.
sentences.chinese: 天时地利，已造就最好的一个地方，给人居住。

sentences.english: That is what makes a quasar.
sentences.chinese: 那就是，究竟是什么造就了一个类星体。

sentences.english: Capable men produce the capable woman ideal.
sentences.chinese: 能干的男人造就能干的巾帼楷模。

sentences.english: A great number of the Nationalist Party leaders came from Guangdong Province, the cradle of the party.
sentences.chinese: 国民党发迹于广东，也造就了大批粤籍党国领袖。

sentences.english: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification, and exhortation, and comfort.
sentences.chinese: 但作先知讲道的，是对人说，要造就，安慰，劝勉人。

sentences.english: The network is already creating a new class of intercity commuters.
sentences.chinese: 铁路网络已经造就一批在城际间上下班的新群体。

sentences.english: He is credited with building the Seattle company into an international success story.
sentences.chinese: 人们认为是他造就了这间西雅图公司在国际上的成功。

sentences.english: The past made us what we are now, and we forget it at our peril.
sentences.chinese: 过去造就了我们现在的样子，我们忘掉它是危险的。

sentences.english: Higgins tried to mould the cockney girl into a elegant lady.
sentences.chinese: 希金斯想把那个柔弱的女孩造就成一位高雅的淑女。

sentences.english: What makes him the 'father' of American fiction?
sentences.chinese: 是什么造就他成为“美国小说之父”？

sentences.english: The abundance of linguistic culture leads to diversifications in the contents and forms of allusions.
sentences.chinese: 丰富的语言文化造就了典故语丰富多彩的内容和形式。

sentences.english: Art education has produced armies of learned bores.
sentences.chinese: 艺术教育同样造就出了一群有学识却令人生厌的人。

sentences.english: He is also the cause of our perceiving what we do .
sentences.chinese: 同时他也造就了我们的感知。

definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
to model/to mold/(fig.) to create (a character, a market, an image etc)/(literature) to portray (in words)
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
blessed by heaven (idiom)/enjoying exceptional advantages/favored by nature
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to come forth in large numbers
to assign/to entrust (a task)/to give/to bestow
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
